alert.note: Alert for Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 1:27AM EST until December 24 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EST THURSDAY FOR THE BLACK RIVER NEAR TOMAHAWK... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected along the Black River near Tomahawk. * WHERE...A portion of the Black River, including Sampson county. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. At 18 ft, minor flooding begins. Water begins to flood NC-411 about one quarter of a mile west of the bridge over the Black River. The Black River and Great Coharie Creek may be near the road levels on Wright Bridge Road and Riley Town Road near the intersection of US-701 outside of Ingold. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 120 AM EST, River gauge reports indicated the Black River near Tomahawk was near minor flood stage. Flooding is expected over the next few hours, and could continue through Wednesday. The river is expected to rise above 18 feet (minor flood) around 2 AM Wednesday. The river may crest near 18.5 ft later Wednesday morning. The river could fall below minor flood stage sometime Wednesday evening. - At 18 ft, minor flooding begins. Water begins to flood NC-411 about one quarter of a mile west of the bridge over the Black River. The Black River and Great Coharie Creek may be near the road levels on Wright Bridge Road and Riley Town Road near the intersection of US-701 outside of Ingold. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ivanhoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
